configuration.stem: As the sun warms Earth’s surface and atmosphere, the dark-colored road heats up more than the surrounding fields. Order the statements to describe what happens next.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Think about how the density of the air changes as it warms and cools. Then think about how denser air moves and how less dense air responds to the movement of denser air.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: The air above the road becomes warmer and less dense than the air above the fields. The cooler surrounding air flows toward the low pressure area and pushes the less dense, warm air upward. The warm air rises and loses energy as it cools. The denser cooled air sinks back down to Earth’s surface.

options.ddoText: The warm air above the road rises and loses energy as it cools.
The air above the road becomes warmer and less dense than the air above the fields.
The denser, cooler air over the fields sinks and flows toward the road.
The denser, cooler air sinks back down to Earth’s surface.
